1.text: Now it happened on the second Sabbath after the first [that] Jesus was walking through the grain fields. His disciples plucked heads of grain and ate them, rubbing the heads in their hands.

2.text: But some among the Pharisees asked them, “Why do you do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?”

3.text: Jesus answered them with these words: “Have not you read what David did when he was hungry, along with those who were with him?

4.text: How he entered into the house of God, took and ate the bread of the Presence and also gave it to those who were with him, even though it is not lawful to eat [from it] except for the priests alone?”

5.text: He said to them, “The Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath.”

6.text: Now it also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and began to teach. A man was there whose right hand was withered.

7.text: The scribes and the Pharisees were watching, to see if Jesus would heal on the Sabbath, so that they might find an accusation against him.

8.text: But he perceived their thoughts. He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up, and stand in the midst [of all];” and the man arose and stood up.

9.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something: Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”

10.text: He looked around at all of them and said to him, “Stretch out your hand!” The man did so, and his hand was restored like the other.

11.text: However, the scribes and the Pharisees were filled with rage and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus.

12.text: It happened in these days, that Jesus went out into the mountain to pray; and he continued all night, in prayer to God.

13.text: When day came, he called his disciples and chose twelve from among them, which he also named ‘apostles’:

14.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;

15.text: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;

16.text: Judas [the brother] of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.

17.text: He came down with them and stood on a level place. A number of his disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea, Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

18.text: Those who were troubled by unclean spirits also came, and they were healed.

19.text: The whole multitude desired to touch him because power came out from him and healed them all.

20.text: Jesus looked up to his disciples, and said:  Blessed are you who are poor,   for yours is the Kingdom of God.

21.text: Blessed are you who hunger now,   for you will be filled.   Blessed are you who weep now,   for you will laugh.

22.text: Blessed are you when men shall hate you,   and when they shall exclude and mock you,   and throw out your name as evil for the sake of the Son of Man.

23.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy,   for behold, your reward is great in heaven,   for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.

24.text: But woe to you who are rich!   For you have received your consolation.

25.text: Woe to you who are full,   for you will be hungry.   Woe to you who laugh now,   for you will mourn and weep.

26.text: Woe [to you,] when all men speak well of you,   for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.

27.text: But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,

28.text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.

29.text: To the one who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other [cheek]. If someone takes away your cloak, do not refuse your coat as well.

30.text: Give to anyone who asks you, and if anyone takes what belongs to you, do not demand it back.

31.text: As you would like others to do to you, do the same to them.

32.text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners love those who love them!

33.text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same!

34.text: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive [back], what credit is that to you? For even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.

35.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back. Then your reward will be great and you will be children of the Most High, for he is kind [even] to the ungrateful and evil.

36.text: Therefore, be merciful,   even as your Father is also merciful.

37.text: Do not judge,   and you will not be judged.   Do not condemn,   and you will not be condemned.   Set free,   and you will be set free.

38.text: Give, and it will be given to you: a good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and overflowing will be given to you. For with the same measure [that] you measure, it will be measured back to you.”

39.text: He spoke a parable to them. “Can the blind guide the blind? Will they not both fall into a pit?

40.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but after being fully trained, everyone will be like their teacher.

41.text: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye but do not consider the beam that is in your own eye?

42.text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you do not see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrites! First, remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will be able to see clearly in order to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.

43.text: For there is no good tree that brings forth rotten fruit, or any rotten tree that produces good fruit.

44.text: Indeed, each tree is recognized by its own fruit! People do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they pick up grapes from a bramble bush.

45.text: Out of the good treasure of his heart, a good person brings out what is good, but out of the evil treasure of his heart, one who is evil brings out what is evil. For out of the overflowing of the heart, the mouth speaks.

46.text: Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?

47.text: I will show you what the person is like who comes to me, hears my words and does them.

48.text: He is like a man building a house who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the water rushed against that house but could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.

49.text: But the one who hears and does not practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. The stream rushed against it, and at once it fell down; and the ruin of that house was great.”
